title: Got permabanned for calling midlaner a bad player after he told me and family to get cancer -
body:
Title. 

Reply from support states they have zero tolerance policy to toxicity, yet that guy is still playing?

Well played Riot, keep thinking automated bots and replies are actually combating toxicity in your game. It's been 9 years and there are still toxic players everywhere - perhaps it isn't working?

replies.body: Well, i saw the log you posted but the e-mail you also posted stated that you were given 8 chances....wondering what you said back then
Doubt. Post chat logs, or we will assume you are not telling us the truth, or at least not all of it.

I posted the log yesterday concerning this ban.

This is the response from Riot/

> Greetings,
> 
> Although I understand where you are coming from and all the frustration involved, please also understand that we have a zero tolerance policy towards toxicity as in there is no excuse for being toxic to another player. Furthermore, such an attitude is unacceptable in a situation where team work should be the main focus.
> 
> Note that toxicity is a fluid term which a lot of players have the misconception that in our community it just refers to swearing. Our punishment system and the Honor system are much more complicated than that. Toxicity in the League of Legends community is negativity in all it's forms. That means that early GG's, sarcastic congratulations, spamming, whining, calling for reports, and harassment are included in this definition.
> 
> Any comments that distract people (even the enemy team) rather than help them, flame rather than aid them are negative behavior that holds you back from progressing. Keep in mind that it isn't limited just to the things I mentioned here, but this is to give you a better idea of it.
> 
> That being said, your account was escalated directly to permanent suspension after that "unfaithful" game.
> 
> Please keep in mind that every suspension issued on your account was a warning and also a chance to reform and you already had plenty (5 chat restrictions and a time ban). Since no reforming took place after these 8 chances your account was issued a permanent suspension.
> 
> No matter the circumstance, joke or not, we do not tolerate such a behavior within our game and punish anyone who is going against our Summoners Code of Conduct.
> 
> That being said, the ban is valid, your intent in that game was clear and we will not lift it nor modify it under no circumstance.


So there is is in black and white.

If you have been banned before etc, you can now be permabanned for saying "GG".

LOL what the fuck is this game.

This isn't a criminal court. This is a company telling you how to behave yourself while you interact with other customers. There is no justification for your poor behavior. You made a choice to break the rules (with a chat log that was clearly rude and way past any grey area) when you were told very clearly what would happen.

> This isn't a criminal court.

Are you just being intentionally obtuse or are just stupid?

I stated that as it's clear evidence that when disagreements between people or infractions of the law occur, CONTEXT MATTERS. This is not something up for debate, and attempting to ignore the direct parallel between the ban system in league and a criminal court in both being means of administering justice and enforcing good behavior is just ignorant at best.

> [{quoted}](name=Skorcher,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=8B5rPdMj,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-16T11:20:40.838+0000)

This is not something up for debate, and attempting to ignore the direct parallel between the ban system in league and a criminal court in both being means of administering justice and enforcing good behavior is just ignorant at best.

You call your teammates "awful," "garbage," and "terrible." You tell your teammates they "lost the game" and accuse them of griefing. What context justifies that? Did it help anything? Did it make people play better? Did any good come of it?

And now, when people try to explain that Riot, as a private company running a video game, doesn't need to look at extenuating circumstances, convene a jury, or anything else if they want to deprive you of your ability to play this video game with this account, you start calling us "obtuse," "stupid," and "ignorant."

Yes, I called the one teammate who afk'd, flamed the team and told people to get cancer garbage.

And yes, when you purposefully state "this isn't a criminal court" while completely ignoring the reasoning behind the post, you are being obtuse.  

Do you honestly not see any parallel between a real life justice system and Riot's one?  Is this your genuine opinion on this, that there is no connection whatsoever thus drawing any parallel makes no sense?

> [{quoted}](name=Skorcher,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=8B5rPdMj,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-16T11:37:28.754+0000)

> 
> Do you honestly not see any parallel between a real life justice system and Riot's one?  Is this your genuine opinion on this, that there is no connection whatsoever thus drawing any parallel makes no sense?

And what did this accomplish? What could it have accomplished?

 

#**NOTHING.**

That is why toxic chat is so difficult to justify. If a teammate is saying nasty things, inting, or otherwise being unpleasant, telling them to stop won't help. You could've put an immediate stop to hearing your teammate wish cancer on you by muting. Arguing back just amplifies the problem.

 

Riot is not a government, representative or otherwise. They are a private entity that generously grants you access to their game that they own. If they suddenly decided to ban everyone and close up shop, they would be within their rights to do that. They're closer to an aggravated dad trying to drive his family to Disneyland but Mary and Timmy haven't learned to get along yet and the bickering is driving poor Dad up the wall, so he says "if you two keep fighting, no Disneyland." Then Mary pokes Timmy, Timmy screams that Mary is a boogerbrain, and Dad makes a U-turn. Timmy then screams "BUT SHE STARTED IT!" Do you think Dad should then say "oh, well in that case everything is fine; let's go see Mickey"? Maybe when everyone calms down, Timmy will explain that Mary poked him, and Dad will ask Mary if that's true, and (hopefully) she admits that it is, so she'll get an admonishment about not provoking her brother.

But they don't get Disneyland.
